intro.title: Interesting Facts
intro.subtitle: A collection of diverse and fascinating facts.

outro.title: Interesting Facts
outro.subtitle: A collection of diverse and fascinating facts.

facts.title: Honey Never Spoils
facts.description: Honey never spoils — archaeologists found edible honey in ancient Egyptian tombs.

facts.title: Octopus Anatomy
facts.description: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.

facts.title: Venus's Day and Year
facts.description: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.

facts.title: Canada's Coastline
facts.description: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.

facts.title: Shortest War
facts.description: The shortest war in history lasted 38–45 minutes (Anglo-Zanzibar War, 1896).

facts.title: Word 'Set'
facts.description: The word 'set' has one of the highest numbers of distinct meanings in English.

facts.title: Flamingo Groups
facts.description: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.

facts.title: Tomatoes in Europe
facts.description: Tomatoes were once considered poisonous in Europe for centuries.

facts.title: First Computer Bug
facts.description: The first computer bug was an actual moth found in a Harvard computer in 1947.

facts.title: Absolute Zero
facts.description: Absolute zero (0 K) is the theoretical temperature where particles have minimal vibrational motion.

facts.title: Bananas and Berries
facts.description: Bananas are berries, while strawberries are not true berries.

facts.title: Bone Remodeling
facts.description: Bones are constantly being remodeled; every 7–10 years many bones are replaced at the cellular level.

facts.title: Nintendo's Origin
facts.description: Nintendo started in 1889 as a Japanese playing-card company.

facts.title: Modern Olympics
facts.description: The modern Olympic Games were revived in 1896 in Athens, Greece.

facts.title: Largest Deserts
facts.description: The world's largest hot desert is the Sahara, but Antarctica is the largest cold desert.

facts.title: Shortest Song
facts.description: The shortest commercially released song is 'You Suffer' by Napalm Death — 1.316 seconds.

facts.title: Fastest Growing Plants
facts.description: Bamboo can be one of the fastest-growing plants — some species grow over 90 cm (35 in) per day.

facts.title: Serial Position Effect
facts.description: Humans are more likely to remember the first and last items in a list (the serial position effect).

facts.title: Chocolate as Currency
facts.description: Chocolate was used as currency by the ancient Aztecs.

facts.title: First Passenger Railway
facts.description: The world's first passenger railway opened in 1825 between Stockton and Darlington in England.

facts.title: Water Expansion
facts.description: Water expands when it freezes, which is why ice floats.

facts.title: Neutron Star Density
facts.description: Neutron stars are so dense that a teaspoon of their material would weigh billions of tons on Earth.

facts.title: Symbol of Peace
facts.description: The white dove became a symbol of peace in modern times after Picasso's lithograph in 1949.

facts.title: First High-Level Language
facts.description: The first high-level programming language often considered 'Fortran' was released in the 1950s.

facts.title: Elephants Can't Jump
facts.description: Elephants are the only mammals that can't jump.

facts.title: Number of Languages
facts.description: There are about 7,000 languages spoken in the world today.

facts.title: Apple Tree Fruiting
facts.description: Apple trees can take 4–5 years to produce their first fruit from seed.

facts.title: Great Wall of China
facts.description: The Great Wall of China is not a single continuous wall — it's a series of walls and fortifications built over centuries.

facts.title: Microwave Oven Invention
facts.description: The microwave oven was invented accidentally after engineer Percy Spencer noticed a chocolate bar melted in his pocket near radar equipment.

facts.title: Cleopatra Timeline
facts.description: Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing (1969) than to the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza.
